sub_subject.name: Comparative Religious Studies & Ethics
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Comparative Religious Studies & Ethics (Bible & Theology)

objectives.objective_text: Identify the Buddha as a teacher who sat under a tree.
Name him as a man who wanted to stop sadness.
Identify that we should do the right thing even if it's hard.
Name 'Fairness' and 'Kindness'.
Identify that God decides what is right and wrong.
Name the Bible as our rule book.
Identify Hinduism as a very old religion from India.
Name 'Karma' as the idea that what you do comes back to you.
Identify the caste system (different levels of people).
Identify temples where people bring fruit and flowers.
Name cows as special animals in India.
Identify Muslims as people who follow Islam.
Name the Mosque as their place of prayer.
Identify Mecca as the most special city for Muslims.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Quran as the holy book of Islam.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Name prayer and giving as things they do.
Identify that Jewish people believe in one God.
Name the Torah (scrolls).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Identify that Jesus was Jewish.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Name the Old Testament as the Bible Jewish people read.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Torah as the most holy books for Jews.
Identify Shabbat (Sabbath) as a day of rest.
Name Hanukkah and Passover.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Identify a wedding as a promise before God.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Name Baptism as a special church event for believers.
Identify that Jesus conquered death.
Name Heaven as the home of believers.
Recall that he taught people to be calm and kind.
Observe statues of the Buddha.
Recall the Golden Rule.
Observe that sometimes we want to do what is easy, not right.
Recall that doing good makes God happy.
Observe that people who don't know God still know right from wrong.
Recall that they believe people are born again and again.
Observe statues of gods with many arms.
Recall that they use statues to help them pray.
Observe the festival of lights (Diwali).
Recall that they believe in one God called Allah.
Observe that they pray on mats.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Recall that they fast (don't eat) during Ramadan.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Observe beautiful writing (calligraphy) in their art.
Recall that they respect God's name very much.
Observe Hebrew writing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Recall that they worship the One True God.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Observe a Menorah or Star of David.
Recall that some foods are not allowed (Kosher).
Observe a Seder meal plate.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Recall that families celebrate when babies are born.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Observe that different religions have different parties.
Recall that we will see Jesus when we die.
Observe that funerals are sad but we have hope.
Summarize the story of Siddhartha Gautama (the prince who left home).
Explain the idea of 'Nirvana' (blowing out the candle of desire).
Explain the concept of 'Anatta' (No Self).
Defend the reality of suffering and the Christian response (Redemption).
Summarize 'The Greatest Good for the Greatest Number' (Utilitarianism).
Explain why the end doesn't justify the means.
Explain the trolley problem (ethical dilemma).
Defend Virtue Ethics as closest to the biblical idea of Sanctification.
Summarize why we need God to have real rules.
Explain that 'Secular' means leaving God out.
Explain Moral Relativism ('That's true for you').
Defend the consistency of Divine Command Theory.
Summarize the idea of Reincarnation.
Explain what the Vedas are (holy books).
Explain the cyclical view of history vs. the biblical linear view.
Defend the distinct personhood of God and humans.
Summarize the 'Trimurti' (Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva).
Explain what an 'Avatar' is (a god coming down in a body).
Explain the difference between Polytheism and Monotheism.
Defend the resurrection of the body against the absorption of the soul.
Produce a reflection on the uniqueness of Christ's sacrifice.
Summarize the story of Muhammad.
Explain that 'Islam' means 'Submission' (obeying).
Explain the difference between Sunni and Shia Muslims.
Defend the historical reliability of the Gospels vs. the Quran.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the Five Pillars (Faith, Prayer, Alms, Fasting, Pilgrimage).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Explain what Hajj is (trip to Mecca).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Categorize the requirements for salvation in Islam (scales of good vs. bad).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Islamic view of Paradise.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Defend Salvation by Grace against Salvation by Works/Pillars.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Produce an essay on the challenge of evangelism to Muslims.
Summarize the importance of the Shema ('Hear O Israel').
Explain what the Talmud is (writings of the teachers).
Explain the Jewish view of sin and atonement without a Temple.
Defend the Christian reading of Isaiah 53 against modern Jewish interpretations.
Produce a study on the concept of 'God's Chosen People'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the story of Abraham as the father of the Jewish people.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Explain that Jewish people are still waiting for the Messiah.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between Orthodox, Conservative, and Reform Judaism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Messiahship of Jesus using the Hebrew Bible.
Summarize the rules of keeping Kosher (dietary laws).
Explain the meaning of Bar/Bat Mitzvah (becoming an adult).
Categorize the major Jewish holidays and what they remember.
Explain the significance of the Western Wall.
Defend the freedom of the Christian from the ceremonial law (Acts 15).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the meaning of Christian Baptism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Explain what a Bar Mitzvah is for Jewish boys.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Categorize rites of passage (growing up ceremonies).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Explain how rituals help communities stay together.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Defend the definition of marriage as between one man and one woman.
Summarize the Christian hope of Resurrection.
Explain Reincarnation (Hindu/Buddhist view) vs. Resurrection.
Explain the difference between Annihilationism and Eternal Conscious Torment.
Defend the reality of Hell and the justice of God.
Produce a reflection on 'O Death, where is your sting?'
Compare the Buddha (a man seeking truth) with Jesus (the Truth).
Apply the value of peace but with a different hope.
Analyze the Four Noble Truths (Life is suffering, caused by desire).
Interpret the Eightfold Path as a way of self-salvation.
Connect Buddhism to its roots in Hinduism (Karma/Reincarnation).
Compare following rules (Duty) with being a good person (Character).
Apply decision-making to a difficult situation.
Analyze Utilitarianism (outcomes) vs. Deontology (rules).
Interpret Virtue Ethics (becoming a certain type of person).
Connect Christian ethics to the character of God (we do good because He is good).
Compare 'Because God says so' with 'Because I feel like it'.
Apply the Ten Commandments to modern life.
Analyze the Euthyphro Dilemma (Is it good because God loves it?).
Interpret the 'Moral Argument' for God.
Connect the idea of human rights to the Image of God.
Compare the one God of the Bible with the millions of gods in Hinduism.
Analyze the concept of Brahman (Ultimate Reality) vs. Atman (Soul).
Interpret the goal of Moksha (escaping the cycle of rebirth).
Compare an idol with the living God.
Apply the biblical command against idolatry.
Analyze the practice of Puja (worship).
Interpret the role of the Guru.
Connect the Ganges river to spiritual cleansing.
Compare Jesus (Son of God) with Isa (Jesus as a Prophet in Islam).
Analyze the claim that the Bible has been corrupted.
Interpret the Shahada ('There is no God but Allah...').
Connect the history of Ishmael to Arab identity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Compare the Bible's structure with the Quran's structure.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the concept of Jihad (inner struggle and outer war).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the role of the Hadith (sayings of Muhammad).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Connect the ritual washing (Wudu) to OT ceremonial laws.
Compare the Christian view of God (Trinity) with the Jewish view (Monotheism).
Apply respect for the Jewish roots of the Christian faith.
Analyze the concept of Mitzvot (Commandments) as a way of life.
Interpret the role of the Rabbi vs. the Priest.
Connect the Oral Law to the traditions Jesus debated.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Compare a Synagogue service with a Church service.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the transition from Temple Judaism to Rabbinic Judaism (AD 70).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the continuity of the moral law vs. the discontinuity of the ceremonial law.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Old Testament prophecies to Jewish expectations today.
Compare Sunday worship with Saturday Sabbath.
Analyze the purpose of the dietary laws in Leviticus (separation).
Interpret the symbolism of the Passover Seder.
Connect the Jewish festivals to the life of Jesus.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Compare a Christian wedding vow with a legal contract.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the covenantal nature of Christian marriage.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the symbolism of water in baptism and other rituals.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Connect confirmation/profession of faith to personal ownership of belief.
Compare a Christian funeral with a pagan one.
Apply 1 Thessalonians 4 ('We do not grieve as those who have no hope').
Analyze the different views of the intermediate state.
Interpret the concept of 'Sheol/Hades' vs. Heaven/Hell.
Connect the Resurrection of Jesus to our future resurrection.
Evaluate the goal of extinguishing the self vs. glorifying God.
Evaluate Kantian ethics (Categorical Imperative) from a Christian view.
Produce an essay on a complex bioethical issue (e.g., genetic engineering).
Evaluate Evolutionary Ethics (morality as survival instinct).
Evaluate the problem of suffering in Hinduism (Karma) vs. Christianity (Fall/Redemption).
Evaluate the social ethics of the Caste System.
Evaluate the Islamic denial of the Crucifixion and Trinity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the concept of Sharia Law and its implications.
Evaluate the historical reliability of the Talmudic traditions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the Jewish rejection of the Trinity (Shema interpretation).
Evaluate the legalism vs. devotion in strict observance.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the secular view of marriage (contract) vs. covenant.
Evaluate Near-Death Experiences (NDEs) through Scripture.
Construct a critique of the Buddhist view of suffering (illusion/detachment).
Synthesize the differences between Theravada and Mahayana Buddhism.
Construct a critique of Utilitarianism using human rights.
Construct a defense of Objective Morality.
Synthesize the relationship between Law and Love.
Construct a critique of Pantheism (God is all).
Synthesize the cultural impact of Hinduism on the West (New Age).
Construct a comparison of the Incarnation of Christ vs. Hindu Avatars.
Construct a critique of the Islamic dilemma regarding the Bible's authority.
Synthesize the theological differences regarding the nature of God (Love vs. Will).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Sacred Texts and The Five Pillars
objectives.objective_text: Construct a comparison of the God of the Quran and the God of the Bible.
Construct a comparison of Soteriology (Salvation by Law/Heritage vs. Grace).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the shared heritage and distinct divergences of the two faiths.
Construct a theological evaluation of Sabbath-keeping for Christians.
Synthesize the prophetic fulfillment of the Feasts.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the sociological function of ritual with theological meaning.
Connect the practice of Yoga to Hindu philosophy.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Judaism’s Relationship to the Old Testament
objectives.objective_text: Construct a theology of Israel and the Church (Covenant vs. Dispensational views).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Birth, Coming of Age, and Marriage
objectives.objective_text: Construct a theology of the family based on Genesis 2 and Ephesians 5.
Construct a biblical theology of death as an enemy that is defeated.
